title: Data ScienceTutorial

metadata.description: Learn about Data ScienceTutorial with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Learn Data Science
Today, Data rules the world. This has resulted in a huge demand for Data Scientists.
A Data Scientist helps companies with data-driven decisions, to make their business better.
Start learning Data Science now »
Learning by Examples
With our "
Example
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy 
  import stats
full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")
x = full_health_data["Average_Pulse"]
y = full_health_data["Calorie_Burnage"]
slope, intercept, r, p, std_err = stats.linregress(x, y)
def myfunc(x):
return 
  slope * x + intercept
mymodel = list(map(myfunc, x))
plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.plot(x, mymodel)
plt.ylim(ymin=0, ymax=2000)
plt.xlim(xmin=0, xmax=200)
plt.xlabel("Average_Pulse")
plt.ylabel ("Calorie_Burnage")
plt.show()

Click on the "
The Python Language
Python is a programming language widely used by Data Scientists.
Python has in-built mathematical libraries and functions, making it easier to calculate mathematical problems and to perform data analysis.
In this tutorial, we will use Python to provide practical examples.
To learn more about Python, please visit our
Python Tutorial
.

★
+1

content_sections.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy 
  import stats
full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")
x = full_health_data["Average_Pulse"]
y = full_health_data["Calorie_Burnage"]
slope, intercept, r, p, std_err = stats.linregress(x, y)
def myfunc(x):
return 
  slope * x + intercept
mymodel = list(map(myfunc, x))
plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.plot(x, mymodel)
plt.ylim(ymin=0, ymax=2000)
plt.xlim(xmin=0, xmax=200)
plt.xlabel("Average_Pulse")
plt.ylabel ("Calorie_Burnage")
plt.show()

practice_exercises.solution:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy 
  import stats
full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")
x = full_health_data["Average_Pulse"]
y = full_health_data["Calorie_Burnage"]
slope, intercept, r, p, std_err = stats.linregress(x, y)
def myfunc(x):
return 
  slope * x + intercept
mymodel = list(map(myfunc, x))
plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.plot(x, mymodel)
plt.ylim(ymin=0, ymax=2000)
plt.xlim(xmin=0, xmax=200)
plt.xlabel("Average_Pulse")
plt.ylabel ("Calorie_Burnage")
plt.show()

summary: This tutorial covers Data ScienceTutorial concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Data ScienceTutorial effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Data ScienceTutorial and how to apply it in your projects.
